name: Casa Portagioia

reviews.text: Just came home after 16 days in Italy. The last five were spent at this little slice of heaven. This was our second time staying with Terry and marcello. We have already booked our room for next spring. Nowhere I have stayed compares to the welcome feeling and the absolute joy I feel at Casa. No matter if you want to relax or run around on day trips you will be happy this is your home base. Terry and marcello go out of their way to acccomadate any need you may have. They are funny and warm hosts. If you love sun kissed sheets that smell of lavender, pristine rooms, great food, and uncomparable views, this is the place for it all. Can't wait to go back.
reviews.title: Heaven on earth.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I were treated to one of the best times or our lives by Terry and Marcello who own and operate this marvelous B&B which is in the middle of one of God's favorite corners of the world. If we had to do it over, we would spend less time in hectic Rome and Florence and maximize our time at Casa P. Peaceful, scenic, upscale......it has all been said before so it is difficult to find new words to describe the quality of the accommodations, food and service that we enjoyed every day. Definitely a five star accommodation with no questions. We are are already planning our next trip to Italy and the highpoint of our next visit will again be Casa Portagioia! Joe & Marena, Englewood Colorado
reviews.title: The Best of the Best........Service extrordinaire!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Casa Portagioia was the second stop in the middle of our 17 day trip through Italy in late March/ early April 2011. Because of the TripAdvisor reviews we had read we were especially excited to arrive in Tuscany. The reviews were correct! Rather than repeat everything that has already been said I would like to thank Terry and Marcello. Thank you for getting it right. For treating your customers like they matter, for giving us a beautiful, comfortable, pleasant place to stay while visiting such a stunning country. You have developed a B&B that travelers dream about and hope they'll find when they arrive at your front door. You are truly splendid hosts - Terry - your humor and knowledge of the area helped make each day an adventure. Marcello - your sweet smile, cooking talents and those cappuccino's are such a great part of our memories. We thank you, sincerely, for making our stay at Casa Portagioia perfect!
reviews.title: What a Vacation Should Be!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Casa Portagioia was a wonderful place to stay in Tuscany. We spent a week in the downstairs apartment and could not have asked for better accommodation or service. The rooms were luxurious yet felt like a home away from home. The surroundings were beautiful and gave us an opportunity to relax in the Tuscan countyside, sipping Prosecca by the pool. Castiglion Fiorentino is an ancient walled city and we were lucky enough to participate in the Good Friday procession through the tiny cobbled streets by candlelight, which was an amazing experience. Terry and Marcello are fantasitc hosts. Their suggestions for places to visit and where to eat ensured that we thoroughly enjoyed every part of our stay at their amazing property. Make sure you take advantage of their on-site dinner experience as it was both delicious and enjoyable.
reviews.title: A wonderful place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The estate is compact enough that you can flit from say your room to the pool or the breakfast area and yet the buildings are angled just so that each place still feels like a private space each of which over looks beautiful Tuscan hills.
reviews.title: Charmed and entertained

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can believe the accolades. They're all true!
reviews.title: Perfection in Tuscany

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were guests of Terry and Marcello for 6 nights. Their attention to detail shows in the accomodations, meals, and service. Wonderful leisurely breakfast on the verandah each morning. We enjoyed chatting with fellow travelers. Our hosts would suggest a daily itinerary for us, lend us one of their TomToms, and off we'd go for our daily adventure. We'd relax at the pool in the late afternoon upon our return to the beautiful grounds. We plan to return some day.
reviews.title: Portagioia deserves 6 stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our only mistake was to drive the rental car to Rome for its return to an office near our hotel. Bad idea. Chaotic city streets with unreadable street signs, insanely crazy drivers, lack of information about the process for car return at Termini.
reviews.title: Fantastic, unbelievable attention to the smallest of details

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Casa Portagioia is exceptional in every way, every detail. You cannot ask for a more beautiful B&B, or more gracious hosts. If you go to Tuscany, and don't stay here, you'll be missing one of the best treasures Italy has to offer.
reviews.title: A Little Piece of Tuscan Magic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cathyann
reviews.title: It truly is the doorway to happiness and joy!!
It Just Doesn't Get Better Than This
reviews.text: We enthusiastically join the chorus of Casa Portagioia fans! The property is in a beautiful location, made all the better by the innkeepers’ exquisite landscaping and attention to detail. You could not want for more gracious and helpful hosts than Terry and Marcello – they anticipated our needs even before we did. Follow their dinner recommendations faithfully -- the only bad meal we had in the area was when we didn’t check with them first. Terry gave us some very good sightseeing tips and Marcello very kindly looked up train times for us when we lost our train schedule in Florence. Breakfast every morning on the veranda was delicious, delightful, and informative. There is a reason Casa Portagioia is so highly rated – these two are dedicated to their business and really know how to run a top-notch operation. We hope to return, but next time there will be less sightseeing and more time just relaxing at Casa Portagioia!

reviews.title: A picture tells a thousand words
reviews.text: We stayed with a group of friends to celebrate a 50th birthday (although he insisted he was still 44 - he wishes). However after a few days resting in this serene setting we all thought we were 44 again!! Location, comfort, facilities - fantastic. Yes, the hosts should also get a mention, because without them Casa Portagioia would not be. Terry & Marcello are very professional and have an excellent and very current knowledge of the surronding areas and happenings. A pity Australia is too far to travel for a weekend otherwise we would have been back again by now. We hope whoever is there in spring is enjoying the floral display that was just coming to life. Next time.

reviews.title: Perfect hosts and the most comfortable bed in Italy
reviews.text: Casa Portagioia is beautiful accommodation in the heart of Tuscany with fantastic hosts. Terry and Marcello really looked after us from the moment we arrived until even after we left with a lovely email. Terry greeted us when we arrived and showed us around the grounds with his hilariously dry sense of humour. Both Terry and Marcello outlined our room and it's facilities, and each day would ask us if we needed advice on what to do and where to go in the area.

reviews.title: Casa Portagioia is the perfect place for a Tuscan get-away!
reviews.text: Casa Portagioia is in possibly the most central location in Tuscany that you could ask for; easy driving distance to Cortona, Arezzo, Sienna, Montepulciano, etc, etc. It is 5 minutes from the gorgeous town of Castiglion Fiorentina, which is quite traditional and is not touristy at all. Keep this in mind when planning your holiday because shops in these local towns and vineyards generally don't open on Sundays. Oh, and don't make the same mistake i did .. make sure you print Terry's directions and take them with you because it's not the easiest place to find the first time.

reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful.
reviews.text: We spent our days driving around the area and thanks to Terry and Marcello we got to experience some amazing local customs, a fantastic vineyard tour, and some brilliant local restaurants. Terry helped us plan our days so we didn't waste time getting lost and didn't miss out on anything. Marcello would offer advice of where to eat, ring and make restaurant reservations wherever and whenever we liked, and give directions.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from our second visit to Casa Portagioia, and it was another wonderful holiday.
reviews.title: You'll want to go back time and time again...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Terry and Marcello often use the slogan 'at home in tuscany' and it couldn't be more appropriate. Visiting Casa Portagioia feels more like a visit to good friends (although I'm not sure if even my best friends would look after me as well as Terry and Marcello). They have created a truly unique retreat in Casa Portagioia. It sits in beautiful surroundings not far from Castiglion Fiorentiino. The combination of excellent accommodation, fabulous surroundings and exceptional hosts make for an unforgettable holiday.
reviews.title: our dream Tuscan property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Terry & Marcello are the most kind and hospitable hosts that any one could hope to meet, they go out of their way to make sure that you have a great holiday and are extremely supportive if you have any problems.
reviews.title: Perfection!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This year our rental car (which we booked independently through Hertz) broke down, the replacement car got a puncture, and on the day before we were due to leave I filled the diesel car with half a tank of unleaded petrol!! …….anywhere else this would have been a nightmare. Terry & Marcello went out of their way on each occasion to help solve our problems. This meant liaising with Hertz (which is difficult at the best of times) arranging transport to pick up a replacement car and even having our contaminated diesel tank cleaned and emptied in time for us to catch a flight home. They work incredibly hard to look after their guests. I cannot thank them enough.
reviews.title: Tuscan country gem

reviews.text: Even with the car problems, we loved staying at Casa Portagioia even more than the first time. We find it such a relaxing place to stay, its like heaven on earth. We rented one of the apartments, which had a kitchen, living room and a private balcony. It was well worth the extra money and gave us the option to stay in some evenings and cook for ourselves. We still opted to have breakfast each morning (Marcello's eggs are the incredible) because it's such a lovely way to start the day. The food and service are really superb and its great to chat with other guests, and share tips/experiences whilst Terry tries to wind people up with his great sense humour.
reviews.title: Perfection

aka: Casa Portagioia, Bed And Breakfast Tuscany Hotel
description: Casa Portagioia - an elegant yet relaxed country retreat in Tuscany – somewhere between a country hotel and your best friend’s home. A place where you can relax, take time to reflect on your travels and to be energized and enthused in to seeing more of the wonderful places Tuscany (& Umbria) have to offer. Always fresh and inviting. 5 guest bedrooms and 2 suite apartments, all with luxury bathrooms and air-conditioning. Everything ‘just so.’
